acf946d8-9f72-4103-a793-b06aa56ec07c.description: The Board of Governors is responsible for setting strategic goals and providing policy direction. Seven of the Board members are knowledgeable in the fields of engineering and engineering technology, while the eighth represents the general public. The nonpublic members of the NICET Board of Governors consist of three Licensed Members of NSPE and four NICET certificants from the engineering technician and engineering technologist populations

badge_template_activities.title: Board members are selected through a multi-faceted nomination process. The licensed engineer members are selected from candidates identified by NSPE Interest Groups and/or from the NSPE membership at large. NICET-certified members are selected from candidates identified by nationally recognized engineering technician membership organizations and/or from the entire body of active NICET certificants. The public member is selected from recognized individuals representing the public at large.

After reviewing nominees' credentials, including industry experience, and other organization activity, the nominating committee, makes the final appointments. A term on the Board lasts three years, and Board members may serve up to two consecutive terms.

17f5a08e-8371-4ab9-9aad-d125f44d2b1e.description: Perform job tasks on complex and specialized systems, and manage multiple projects at once. Serve as a liaison between AHJs, owners, engineers, and contractors. They can interpret codes and standards, supervise Level I, II, and III technicians, and take ownership of programs and training. Level IV technicians have at least 10 years of experience in fire alarm systems.

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate knowledge by passing Levels I, II & III certification exams
Successfully demonstrate the ability to competently and repeatedly perform the Level I, II, III & IV Performance Measure activities.

A min of 10 yrs of fire detection & signaling systems experience, which MUST include at least 45 months of fire alarm systems experience, including technical business management and/or a management role in installation, maintenance, inspection, testing, commissioning, technical system estimating & sales, plan preparation, and/or code compliance review. The five additional years from Level III must include at least two years of overseeing fire alarm systems project management.
Obtain a personal recommendation showing a capacity for independent engineering technician responsibilities
Provide a detailed description of a major project and your role in it showing senior responsibility for a fire alarm system project of substantial complexity
